comment.author: 38811045@N04
comment._content: Living in Camden Town, enlisted Handel Street. His number - 3189 - indicates he joined the 1st London Regiment in November 1914.

comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content:
Commonwealth War Graves Commissin lists following
BROWN, WILLIAM
Rank:Corporal Service No:3189
Date of Death:15/09/1916
Regiment/Service:London Regiment (Royal Fusiliers)  1st Bn. 
Panel Reference Pier and Face 9 D and 16 B. Memorial THIEPVAL MEMORIAL

comment.author: 77481759@N04
comment._content: It is quite possible this Gentleman was one of my Great Uncles colleagues, as he may have been in the same Regiment. Does anybody out there know huge amounts about the Royal Fusilliers? Have hit a brick wall, cannot prove where or who he was with - any bright suggestions gratefully received.....
